duties_responsibilities.duty: Respond to and diagnose problems through discussion with users.
Ensure timely problem resolution, including problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution, and follow-up.
Act as lead technician by handling escalations from peers and serving as focal point for customer concerns.
Provide support to end users on a variety of technical issues.
Identify, research, and resolve technical problems.
Respond to telephone calls, emails, and personnel requests for technical support.
Document, track, and monitor requests and incidents using ITSM methods and procedures to ensure a timely resolution.
Provide on-site second-tier support to end users for PC, server, or mainframe applications or hardware.
Interact with network services, software systems engineering, and/or applications development to restore service and/or identify and correct core problems.
Simulate or recreate user problems to resolve operating difficulties.
Recommend systems modifications to reduce user problems.
Install and configure system hardware/software in an enterprise environment.
Install operating system patches and upgrades.
Support desktop operating systems such as Windows 7, 8.X, 10, and Mac OSX 10.10.X.
Provide remote support using an endpoint management tool.
Provide administrative support in an IT environment.
Demonstrate proficient time management and detail-oriented organizational skills.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in IT or related field or equivalent experience.

Preferred industry certifications: CompTIA or equivalent, Apple Certified Support Professional, Microsoft 365 Certified: Desktop Administrator, VMware AirWatch Associate Accreditation or equivalent, Enterprise Mobility (MDM)
